item.title: Report E-2024030290
item.description:
Report E-2024030290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1760 Nalco 5177 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote lid due to a fault cap. The cap was replaced with a new one and the tote body was wiped down and secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbent pads and PPE were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030541
item.description:
Report X-2024030541

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED FOR A SPILL AT THE END OF THE NIGHT. DMP WENT TO THE SPILL WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART, ALL APPROPRIATE PPE ON, AND CREATED A 15FT HOTZONE. THE DECISION TREE WAS USED. THE INITAL READING WAS OUT OF THE 6-9 RANGE. AFTER NEUTRALIZING THE SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND RETURNED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2024030263
item.description:
Report X-2024030263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030263 SequenceEvent: Package was found in Hazmat cage. Closures of box were open on the bottom. Drum was outside of the box. DescribePack: Upon close examination, no severe damage was seen on the drum but a small amount of spilled powder was seen inside of the plastic bag containing the drum. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Only a small amount of powder was seen next to the drum. 2. X-2024030264 SequenceEvent: Package was found in Hazmat cage. Bottom closure was coming open on box. A small amount of powder was seen next to the open closure. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the plastic bucket was cracked at the bottom causing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was placed into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024030498
item.description:
Report X-2024030498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on conveyor belt near a load door with small wet spots, then moved to Hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the four bottles of Result 100 Dish Machine Detergent had a loose cap and all 4 had spilled liquid on them. Cap was tightened but this bottle continued to exhibit a small drip when turned sideways. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Package was placed in a carrying tote lined with a Hazmat bag and moved to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024030491
item.description:
Report X-2024030491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg leaked small amounts of product during transit. Pkg was loaded correctly, but the closure was loose so small amounts of product was able to be released. At discovery, the hazmat6 was transported to the hazmat processing area in a lined hazardous tote. DescribePack: Close on one bottle was super loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazardous material was immediately moved from the area so pkg handlers could continue the sort in a safely manner.

item.title: Report X-2024030265
item.description:
Report X-2024030265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: ONE OF 4 BOTTLES MISSING CAP. NOT RECOVERED WITH DAMAGED CONTENTS OR PACKAGING. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP HOLE COVERED WITH A NITRILE GLOVE AT THE OPENING AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED. ENTIRE BOTTLE WAS LAYERED IN SHRINK WRAP. BOXES WERE PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED. ALL DAMAGED PACKAGING AND ALL CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED.

item.title: Report X-2024030319
item.description:
Report X-2024030319

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unknown. Package was left at hazmat cage with no information provided. Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: The package appears to have been dropped onto something sharp that punctured one of the interior containers, causing it to leak over the other containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Unknown. Package was left at hazmat cage with no information provided. Package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030251
item.description:
Report X-2024030251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA when package handler realized the top of the bucket was wet and leaking. DescribePack: The bucket was leaking through the small cap on the lid. This cap was not properly sealed correctly because it was seal at a crooked angle. Cap won't move due to the crooked angle and will still leak if corrosive liquid reach the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was taken to QA and placed in a black tub for hazmat.

  • Description: Customer came to the back galley holding vape that was smoking, hot, and smelled like burning plastic. He said it was in his pocket and he felt it getting hot. We used the fire containment bag as directed and stored it in an empty cart. The bag was left with the team in QRO. passenger was seated in 26D and was not using the vape.
